author: @Region8News
title: City honors cancer community at Arbor Day ceremony
text:
City honors cancer community at Arbor Day ceremony
TRUMANN, Ark. (KAIT) - A tree planted in Poinsett County honors cancer patients, survivors, and loved ones who lost their lives fighting the disease.
A proclamation from Mayor Jay Paul Woods deems April 23, 2025, as Arbor Day to support efforts to protect trees and woodlands in the city of Trumann.
Students, teachers, and city officials gathered around a new tree planted at Trumann Elementary School, where fourth-grade teacher Chea Palmer is actively going through breast cancer treatment.
Palmer said doctors caught it early, but she encourages all women to get mammograms regularly.
‚ÄúI was diagnosed with stage one breast cancer in January, and I had a double mastectomy at the end of February,‚Äù Palmer said. ‚ÄúAnd so far, I‚Äôm showing cancer-free.‚Äù
Grown with gratitude and never forgotten, the city said the tree symbolizes strength in the face of struggle, healing through hope, and love that never fades.
To report a typo or correction, please click here.
Copyright 2025 KAIT. All rights reserved.

author: @Thenationth
title: Thunderstorms and severe weather conditions forecast for parts of Thailand
text:
The Thai Meteorological Department has issued a severe weather warning, forecasting summer storms across upper regions of the country from Thursday to Saturday.
Residents are urged to prepare for thunderstorms, strong winds, isolated hail, and potential lightning strikes.
The latest warning, released on Wednesday, covers the lower northern, lower northeastern, lower central, and eastern regions, including Bangkok and its surrounding areas. A moderate high-pressure system from China, combined with hot and humid conditions, is expected to trigger these volatile weather patterns.
Provinces at risk:
Thursday: Phichit, Phitsanulok, Phetchabun (North); Loei, Nong Khai, Bueng Kan, Udon Thani, Sakon Nakhon, Nakhon Phanom, Kalasin, Mukdahan, Khon Kaen, Maha Sarakham, Roi Et, Yasothon, Amnat Charoen, Nakhon Ratchasima, Buriram, Surin, Sisaket, Ubon Ratchathani (Northeast); Nakhon Sawan, Lopburi, Saraburi (Central); Nakhon Nayok, Prachinburi, Sa Kaeo, Chachoengsao, Chonburi, Rayong, Chanthaburi, Trat (East).
Friday: Tak, Kamphaeng Phet, Phichit, Phitsanulok, Phetchabun (North); Chaiyaphum, Khon Kaen, Maha Sarakham, Roi Et, Nakhon Ratchasima, Buriram, Surin (Northeast); Nakhon Sawan, Lopburi, Saraburi, Singburi, Ang Thong, Ayutthaya, Suphanburi, Ratchaburi, Nakhon Pathom, Samut Sakhon, Samut Songkhram, Bangkok and surrounding areas (Central); Nakhon Nayok, Prachinburi, Sa Kaeo, Chachoengsao, Chonburi, Rayong, Chanthaburi, Trat (East); Prachuap Khiri Khan, Chumphon (South).
Saturday: Suphanburi, Ratchaburi, Nakhon Pathom, Samut Sakhon, Samut Songkhram, Bangkok and surrounding areas (Central); Prachuap Khiri Khan, Chumphon (South).
Weather outlook:
Hot and hazy conditions are expected throughout the day, with temperatures reaching up to 40 degrees Celsius in some areas.
Thunderstorms are forecast, with a 10% chance in many regions, accompanied by strong winds.
Coastal areas may experience rough seas during thunderstorms, with waves more than a metres high.
Advice for the public
Residents are advised to avoid travel during thunderstorms and stay clear of open areas, large trees, and unstable structures.
Farmers should secure crops and livestock, the department said.
The public has been urged to monitor weather updates and take precautions against the heat.
For the latest updates, please visit the Thai Meteorological Department website at http://www.tmd.go.th or contact their hotline on 0-2399-4012-13 or 1182.

title: Occupants failed to surround Ukrainian forces near Pokrovsk - ISW | –£–ù–ù
text: Occupants failed to surround Ukrainian forces near Pokrovsk - ISW Kyiv ‚Ä¢ UNN Enemy troops did not reach the tactical encirclement of Ukrainian forces. The Ukrainian Armed Forces retreated from limited positions in the Pokrovsk sector. The invaders failed to reach the tactical encirclement of Ukrainian forces southeast of Pokrovsk. This is reported by ISW, UNN reports. Details Ukrainian forces were forced to retreat from their limited positions in the Pokrovsk sector after a recent advance by enemy troops. Although the occupiers captured Ptyche and advanced further south, they were unable to reach the tactical encirclement of Ukrainian forces as planned. Geolocation data confirms that Russian troops seized part of the eastern shore of the Karlivka reservoir, but their advance did not create the conditions for encircling Ukrainian positions. author: stovar
title: NFL News: Ravens QB Lamar Jackson reacts to career-high speed against Texans - Bolavip US
text:
NFL NFL News: Ravens QB Lamar Jackson reacts to career-high speed against Texans It was Lamar Jackson's record-setting speed that proved to be the difference against the Houston Texans. The Baltimore Ravens quarterback's career-best rushing performance propelled his team to a crucial victory in Week 17 in the NFL. Steelers make final decision about Russell Wilson's contract and future Bengals' Joe Burrow might be without a key weapon against the Broncos By Santiago Tovar
December 26, 2024 04:39PM EDT
December 26, 2024 04:39PM EDT
¬© IMAGO / ZUMA Press Wire Owings Mills, Md, USA: Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson (8) during a practice session at the Under Armour Performance Center on Dec 23, 2024, in Owings Mills, Maryland. By Santiago Tovar
Baltimore Ravens quarterback Lamar Jackson , renowned for his electric speed that disrupts game plans, outdid even himself during their recent matchup against the Houston Texans . Jackson, a player who stands out for his mobility among NFL quarterbacks, clocked the fastest speed of his career on the field.
While official figures weren‚Äôt immediately available from the Ravens, reports suggest Jackson surpassed 21 miles per hour during his electrifying 48-yard touchdown run against Houston . This impressive feat not only shatters his personal record but further cements his status as one of the league‚Äôs fastest players, regardless of position.
The media, naturally intrigued, bombarded Jackson with questions about his record-breaking speed and its significance. However, his response was laced with humor, catching everyone by surprise. ‚ÄúI was jogging,‚Äù Jackson chuckled, then playfully redirected the question back to the reporters, ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt have to do anything, but that was cool.‚Äù
Advertisement Advertisement This performance raises a crucial question: can Jackson maintain this explosive level of athleticism throughout the season? Given the grueling nature of NFL competition, staying healthy is absolutely critical.

author: Hiba El Bouchtaoui
title: How two scientists are using language models to democratize climate data in Morocco
text: Beginning with an inquiry on Morocco, two German scientists developed ClimSight, a tool based on language models to assist in quickly and inexpensively summarizing, aggregating, and communicating localized climate-related data to people. They say that a straightforward proof-of-concept prototype could support the claim that the method of combining language models with crop-related climate predictions has the potential to effectively democratize climate information. ‚ÄúConsider an individual who owns a parcel of land in Morocco and contemplates its use for wheat cultivation. They are aware of changes in the climate, and concerned regarding potential impacts on their agricultural venture,‚Äù said the scientists in the research published in Nature Science magazine. What might sharing climate information look like in the future? [@JungAwi]and I are experimenting with an AI-based approach that could potentially bring local climate information from projects like [#DestinE]to everyone. Published today in [@CommsEarth]: [https://t.co/aOWB7Vv1Co] 1/3 [pic.twitter.com/TBC7rSA71Y] ‚Äî Nikolay Koldunov @ [[email protected]](@oceanographer) [January 5, 2024] They set ClimSight to work on a query about a specific geographical point, ‚ÄúI intend to cultivate wheat. What are the implications of climate change?‚Äù With the help of a large language model (LLM), ClimSight serves as a localized decision-making assistant that evaluates the impact of climate change on specific activities, after providing a thorough answer to the query. Despite being a scientific breakthrough, ClimSight is still rather basic; it only collects a limited amount of information about the area of interest, relies solely on the output of a single, low-resolution climate model simulation, and ignores uncertainty estimates. The two scientists, Thomas Jung, and Nikolay Koldunov believe that it is likely that the majority of users will be curious about climate impacts over the next ten to thirty years, which is why the tool tries to foresee future climate scenarios. ClimSight links user queries to climate change information and demonstrates a high degree of proficiency in conveying and summarizing climate data. In response to the test on Morocco, the tool gave insights on temperature, precipitation, wind, policy, and regulatory implications as well as recommendations aligning perfectly with the climate predictions it offers. It also delves into potential risks and helps the inquirers to figure out their next step. As the technology used to provide information to the tool isn‚Äôt free of constraints, the scientists hope to expand the scope of their system and transition to open-source models instead of the large language models they are currently using. ClilSight‚Äôs creators, very aware of the risks that come with using AI in such a project, said ‚Äú Arguably more important than expansion, is the task of ensuring that users are aware of the degree of reliability of the information they receive. Large language models can occasionally generate erroneous information and fabricate facts, and climate projections are subject to their own set of inherent uncertainties and potential biases. It would be important to make the reliability of the system‚Äôs output intuitively transparent, for example by providing a range of possible future scenarios rather than just one recommendation. Furthermore, incorporating information on local model biases, drift, and ensemble spread would add confidence and trustworthiness to the recommendations communicated to the user.‚Äù

author: https://www.facebook.com/megacurioso
title: 'Nuvens arco-√≠ris' coloriram os c√©us do √Årtico por 3 dias
text:
No frio intenso do √Årtico um espet√°culo raro de nuvens estratosf√©ricas polares (PCSs, na sigla em ingl√™s) transformou os c√©us em uma explos√£o de cores, iluminando a regi√£o por tr√™s dias consecutivos, entre 18 e 20 de dezembro. Conhecidas como 'nuvens nacaradas', essas maravilhas celestiais, que parecem sa√≠das de um sonho ou de um filme, surgiram devido a uma onda de frio incomum na atmosfera superior.
As nuvens, feitas de min√∫sculos cristais de gelo que refratam a luz solar, criaram um arco-√≠ris deslumbrante que se estendeu pelos c√©us da Noruega, Su√©cia, Finl√¢ndia, Alasca e o sul da Esc√≥cia. O fen√¥meno, capturado pelas lentes talentosas da fot√≥grafa norueguesa Ramune ≈†apailaite, revelou uma paleta de cores iridescentes (coloridas, como um arco-√≠ris), proporcionando um evento espetacular.
Nuvens brilhantes C√©u no C√≠rculo Polar √Årtico ficou extremamente brilhante no final de dezembro. (Fonte: Ramune ≈†apailaite - Facebook/ Divulga√ß√£o)
As nuvens nacaradas s√£o uma raridade, formando-se entre 15 e 25 quil√¥metros acima da superf√≠cie terrestre. Em climas extremamente frios, pequenos cristais de gelo se agrupam, dispersando a luz solar e criando essas maravilhas cintilantes. Para a forma√ß√£o desse fen√¥meno, a temperatura tem de estar extremamente baixa, algo pr√≥ximo a -85 ¬∞C.
Ramune ≈†apailaite, que testemunhou e fotografou o fen√¥meno sobre Gran, no sul da Noruega, descreveu as cores como "espetaculares", enfatizando que a explos√£o de tons acontecia especialmente nos momentos que antecediam o p√¥r do sol .
Os especialistas dizem que as nuvens nacaradas que brilharam nos c√©us do √Årtico s√£o classificadas como sendo do Tipo II. Essas nuvens, do Tipo II, s√£o compostas por cristais de gelo puros, resultando em cores mais vibrantes do que as nuvens do Tipo I, que s√£o perigosas e podem afetar a camada de oz√¥nio.
El Ni√±o e Mudan√ßas Clim√°ticas Nuvens estratosf√©ricas polares s√£o extremamente coloridas e fazem um belo espet√°culo. (Fonte: Ramune ≈†apailaite - Facebook/ Divulga√ß√£o)
A forma√ß√£o excepcional dessas nuvens est√° intrinsecamente ligada a condi√ß√µes clim√°ticas espec√≠ficas. A estratosfera seca normalmente n√£o permite a forma√ß√£o de nuvens, mas em temperaturas extremamente baixas, o √Årtico se transforma em um palco para esse espet√°culo raro.
De acordo com os especialistas, a recente onda de frio que desencadeou a apari√ß√£o precoce das nuvens nacaradas possivelmente teve influ√™ncia do j√° conhecido El Ni√±o . Contudo, eles apontam tamb√©m para a influ√™ncia de outro agente: a mudan√ßa clim√°tica gerada pelo homem.
Normalmente, as nuvens estratosf√©ricas polares costumam ocorrer em raros dias no inverno, tendo o in√≠cio das apari√ß√µes ocorrendo no m√™s de janeiro. No entanto, os cientistas acreditam que como esse fen√¥meno aconteceu antes do previsto e por tr√™s dias seguidos, deve ser um sinal de que haver√° mais eventos magn√≠ficos como esse durante o ano.
A beleza ef√™mera dessas nuvens adiciona uma dose extra de magia √† temporada, j√° que o √Årtico √© um ponto tur√≠stico importante para aqueles que querem ver de perto o fen√¥meno da aurora boreal.
